intro: Polygala gracilipes var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight bluish-gray hue, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, pink to purple flowers are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences, which bloom in late spring to early summer. This plant is adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
